entries.title: Rehabilitating the children of repatriated jihadists: 'We can achieve dramatic results with the protocols in place'
entries.description: On Tuesday, January 24, 32 minors residing in Kurdish camps returned to France. In an interview with 'Le Monde,' State Secretary for Children, Charlotte Caubel, discusses the policies and challenges of rehabilitating these children.

entries.title: Ukraine is also at war with Russian propagandists
entries.description: Kyiv has imposed individual economic sanctions against 317 people accused of promoting the Kremlin's narrative and is encouraging its allies to do the same.

entries.title: Peruvian president Dina Boluarte asks Congress to advance elections amidst ongoing protests
entries.description: Demanding that Boluarte resign and call fresh elections, Castillo supporters have erected roadblocks on highways, causing shortages of food, fuel in the South American country.

entries.title: Study shows shockingly high levels of Holocaust denial in the Netherlands
entries.description: According to a survey, 23% of 18-40 year olds believe that the number of Jewish victims has been greatly exaggerated.

entries.title: Gunman near Jerusalem synagogue kills at least five
entries.description: The attack came a day after a raid conducted by the Israeli army in the West Bank killed nine.

entries.title: In Paris, left-wing bookstore wants to 'shake up' right-wing neighborhood
entries.description: In the very chic 7th arrondissement, serial entrepreneur Ramdane Touhami has opened a politically-engaged bookstore, specializing in social and anti-racist struggles.

entries.title: Japan aims at ending birth rate decline
entries.description: The country's steadily declining birthrate since the 1970s accelerated with the Covid-19 pandemic.

entries.title: Israeli's assault in Jenin: A day of violence
entries.description: Nine Palestinians died in the refugee camp following the attack conducted by Israel's military in the West Bank on Thursday, the bloodiest in two decades.

entries.title: Washington 'deeply concerned' by West Bank violence
entries.description: Israeli forces on Thursday killed nine Palestinians in the deadliest single incident in the occupied West Bank in two decades.

entries.title: Myanmar's military government enacts new political party law
entries.description: The electoral law will make it difficult for opposition groups to mount a serious challenge to army-backed candidates.

entries.title: French pension reform: Leaders from hardline CGT union want to hit bosses' wallets
entries.description: Outside an oil refinery in the south of France, union leaders gathered for a rally, calling on workers to 'block the economy' and 'ruin' the powerful.

entries.title: Immigration rose in France in 2022, driven by labor needs and foreign students
entries.description: In 2022, more than 320,000 first residence permits were issued, and 15,000 foreigners were deported from the country. The share of labor immigration has never been so high.

entries.title: Holocaust Memorial Day: Auschwitz-Birkenau anniversary marked as peace again shattered by war
entries.description: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky marked the day commemorating the liberation of the Nazi German death camp by alluding to his own country's situation.

entries.title: Djokovic says images of his father with Russian flags 'misinterpreted'
entries.description: The Serbian tennis star admitted that the controversy swirling around his father Srdjan had 'got to me,' but maintained no harm was meant.

entries.title: India to get 12 more cheetahs from Africa in reintroduction effort
entries.description: The 12 South African cats are to join the eight already received from Namibia in September.

entries.title: The EU extends sanctions on Russia over Ukraine for six months
entries.description: The sanctions, originally imposed when Moscow annexed Crimea from Ukraine in 2014, were significantly ramped up after the start of the all-out invasion in February 2022.

entries.title: Poland, Belgium offer additional military aid to Ukraine
entries.description: Warsaw said on Thursday it would deliver 60 more tanks to Kyiv. Belgium promised cash, missiles, machine guns and armored vehicles.

entries.title: French Socialists in disarray ahead of party convention: 'I’m done, they drove me to despair long ago'
entries.description: Members of France's Parti Socialiste are fed up with the infighting caused by the recent leadership election, where two contestants both claimed victory.

entries.title: Aya Nakamura, the 'Queen' of French pop
entries.description: Her hits have made her the most listened-to French-speaking artist in the world. The 27-year-old's fourth album, 'DNK' was released on Friday and is entirely her own creation.

entries.title: Watchdog blames Syria's air force for deadly 2018 chlorine attack
entries.description: A report by the OPCW said there are "reasonable grounds to believe" that during a government military offensive to recapture Douma, at least one Syrian air force helicopter dropped two yellow cylinders on the city.

entries.title: In Peru, 'Boluarte is acting without control from Congress, the judiciary or the media'
entries.description: In an interview, sociologist Omar Coronel explains the specifics of the current protests in Peru and the response from President Dina Boluarte's government.

entries.title: Azerbaijan evacuates Tehran embassy after deadly attack
entries.description: Baku says Iran is responsible for the 'terrorist' attack on its embassy on Friday, in which an official in charge of security was killed and two guards wounded.

entries.title: Australian Open: Tsitsipas beats Khachanov to reach first final in Melbourne
entries.description: The Greek will play either Novak Djokovic or Tommy Paul in the final, after beating Karen Khachanov 7-6 (2), 6-4, 6-7 (6), 6-3.

entries.title: LVMH rakes in record 79.2 billion euros in 2022
entries.description: The operating margin of the French luxury group reached 26.6% and net profit topped €14 billion.

entries.title: French rugby chief Bernard Laporte quits after corruption conviction
entries.description: Laporte received a two-year suspended prison sentence in December.

entries.title: US news agency AP backtracks after advising that writing 'the French' is 'dehumanizing'
entries.description: The Associated Press stylebook on Thursday advised against the use of 'general and often dehumanizing ‘the’ labels such as the poor, the mentally ill, the French, the disabled.'

entries.title: In Iran, the defense of the regime is a budget priority
entries.description: Against a backdrop of an economic crisis and protests, Iranian authorities have prioritized military, security and propaganda institutions over the population's purchasing power.

entries.title: After 2.1% growth in 2022, the United States hopes to escape recession
entries.description: Unemployment in the United States is at its lowest level in 50 years. But with interest rates at a high level, there are still concerns about an economic slowdown.

entries.title: Paris exhibition of Baya's art shows vivid mark left by Algerian childhood
entries.description: The Institut du Monde Arabe in Paris is devoting a retrospective to the self-taught painter and sculptor Fatma Haddad, whose work has been interpreted in a range of ways.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: 'We must stop thinking about negotiating Ukraine's borders for Ukrainians'
entries.description: Bernard Guetta, the Renew MEP (liberal), says that diplomacy is not incompatible with the delivery of arms to Ukraine, fearing escalation to a third-world war.

entries.title: The Russian army restores disciplinary control
entries.description: The Russian ministry of defense is reviving military prisons, harshening sentences for deserters and implementing haircut regulations to improve the image of the army and prepare for future offensives.

entries.title: Israel and Gaza militans exchange missiles following deadly raid in the West Bank
entries.description: Palestinian militants fired five rockets at Israel, the military said. Israel carried out a series of airstrikes at what it said were militant targets.

entries.title: Haiti: protests erupt in Port-au-Prince over killings of police officers by gangs
entries.description: The protesters tried to storm the offices of Prime Minister Ariel Henry and ran onto the runway of Toussaint Louverture International Airport, disrupting air traffic.

entries.title: The talented Mr. Santos, a Republican congressman's endless fiction
entries.description: The New York Republican blithely falsified his résumé and lied about his origins, family, private life and commitments. Much like the Trump movement to which he is close, his relationship with the truth is a complicated affair.

entries.title: Who is J.R. Moehringer, Prince Harry's ghostwriter?
entries.description: For Moehringer, this is the third time that he has stepped behind a celebrity – at least as far as we know. His method: he literally slips into the skin of his characters to write about their lives in first person.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Russian missile strikes across multiple cities kill 11 people
entries.description: The latest wave of Russian attacks came as the Kremlin said it perceived the tanks 'as direct involvement in the conflict'.

entries.title: US economy grew in fourth quarter of 2022 despite high inflation
entries.description: The economy got a boost last quarter from resilient consumer spending and the restocking of supplies by businesses. Federal government spending also helped lift GDP.

entries.title: 'China's fertility decline fell below the replacement level in the mid-1990s'
entries.description: According to sinologist Isabelle Attané, the demographic decline in China was anticipated and the decrease in fertility among Chinese women predates the implementation of the one-child policy.
